title: Navy Engineer and Wife Plead Not Guilty to Charges of Trying to Sell Nuclear-Submarine Secrets
sub_head: Jonathan Toebbe to remain in jail ahead of December trial; judge to rule on Diana Toebbeâ€™s detention
body:
A U.S. Navy employee and his wife pleaded not guilty Wednesday to charges of trying to sell nuclear-submarine secrets to a foreign country, during a hearing that included testimony from an FBI agent about how an undercover operation to catch the couple unfolded over the past year.
Jonathan Toebbe and his wife Diana Toebbe appeared in separate hearings in federal court in West Virginia after their arrest this month on accusations that Mr. Toebbe, a nuclear engineer, had provided several sets of documents containing classified information about a nuclear-powered warship known as the Virginia-class submarine to someone he believed to be from a foreign military intelligence service.
